purpleculture_pinyin:
jǔ
to lift; to hold up; to cite; to enumerate; to act; to raise; to choose; to elect; act; move; deed
поднимать; задержать; Цитировать; перечислять; играть; поднять; выбирать; Выбирать; действовать; двигаться; поступок
rtega_mnemonic:
舉舉RS
挙挙		举raise, lift up, recommend
  • hand 扌/手 raising something 與/兴
purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 举)
Pictophonetic: 舉 (hand) indicates the sound; 扌 conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
舉行 [ jǔ xíng ]: to hold (a meeting, ceremony etc)
舉辦 [ jǔ bàn ]: to conduct; to hold
舉措 [ jǔ cuò ]: to move; to act; action; decision; conduct; manner
舉報 [ jǔ bào ]: to report (malefactors to the police); to denounce
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿱ Above to below
    • 與 [ yǔ ] and; with; to; for; to give, to grant
    • 扌 [ shǒu ] hand
heisig_chinese_memo: Back in the day, if a family was having a hard time, their friends would offer them cornstalks for a lift up.  Nowadays, they might transfer them some money.
Ru_trainchinese:
jǔ: (глаг) поднимать; выбирать; упоминать, перечислять
jǔ: (графема) начинать, инициировать; действие, поступок; весь, целиком, полностью; (сокр.) успешный кандидат (на имперских экзаменах во времена династий Мин и Цин)
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: A farmer's excitement has everything to do with his cornstalk yield.  If it's a good season he likes to lift up his son and throws him in the air!
humanum_full_description_en:
From the sound of " hand " and " and ", the original meaning is to hold things up with both hands. "Shuowen": "Right and lift. From the hand, with the sound." "Mencius·Gaozixia": "Today, if you lift a Baijun, you are a powerful person."

" Lift " can mean flying, rising. "The Analects of Confucius-Xiangdang": "Se Si lifted up, Xiang and then set."

" Ju " also means to ask questions and to ask questions. "Book of Rites-Qu Lishang": "The host does not ask, the guest does not first raise it." Kong Yingdashu: "It also asks. The guest comes from outside, it is recommended to ask whether the road is cold or hot. If the host does not ask, the guest should not ask first. "

" Ji " also means words, deeds and actions. "Mandarin-Lu Yushang": "The ruler's judgement must be written, and the book is not lawful. What is the view of the heirs?" Wei Zhao's note: "Motion is left to history, and words are right.

" Ji " also means rise and start. "Historical Records: The Biography of Chunshen Jun": "The king raised his armour to attack Wei."

" Li " also means to conquer and occupy. "Guliang Chuan-Two Years of Gong Xi": "The sacrifice of the public and the death of the Guo, five years later, will raise concerns."

" Cite " can also mean raising or enumerating. "The Analects of Confucius-Shuer": "If you don't take the three corners, you will no longer have it."
humanum_short_description_en: From the " hand " and " and " sound, the original meaning is to hold things up with both hands.
humanum_full_description:
從「手」，「與」聲，本義為雙手托物使之向上。《說文》：「對舉也。从手，與聲。」《孟子‧告子下》：「今曰舉百鈞，則為有力人矣。」

　　「舉」可表示飛起、升起。《論語‧鄉黨》：「色斯舉矣，翔而後集。」

　　「舉」也表示發問、動問。《禮記‧曲禮上》：「主人不問，客不先舉。」孔穎達疏：「舉亦問也。客從外來，宜問路中寒熱無恙，若主人未問，則客不可先問也。」

　　「舉」還表示言行、舉動。《國語‧魯語上》：「君舉必書，書而不法，後嗣何觀？」韋昭注：「動則左史書之，言則右史書之。」

　　「舉」也表示興起、發動。《史記‧春申君列傳》：「王又舉甲而攻魏。」

　　「舉」亦表示攻克、占領。《穀梁傳‧僖公二年》：「獻公亡虢，五年而後舉虞。」

　　「舉」亦可表示提出、列舉。《論語‧述而》：「舉一隅不以三隅反，則不復也。」
humanum_short_description: 從「手」，「與」聲，本義為雙手托物使之向上。
_purpleculture_dictionary_orig_full:
舉 (Simplified: 举)
Pinyin: jǔ
English Definition: to lift; to hold up; to cite; to enumerate; to act; to raise; to choose; to elect; act; move; deed
Total strokes: 16; Radical: 臼
Pictophonetic: 舉 (hand) indicates the sound; 扌 conveys the meaning.
Character Formation:
  • ⿱ Above to below
    • 與 [ yǔ ] and; with; to; for; to give, to grant
    • 扌 [ shǒu ] hand
Example Words:
舉行 [ jǔ xíng ]: to hold (a meeting, ceremony etc)
舉辦 [ jǔ bàn ]: to conduct; to hold
舉措 [ jǔ cuò ]: to move; to act; action; decision; conduct; manner
舉報 [ jǔ bào ]: to report (malefactors to the police); to denounce

舉舉RS
挙挙 		举 raise, lift up, recommend
  • hand 扌/手 raising something 與/兴
(Simplified: 举)
Chinese Definition:
Pictophonetic: 舉 (hand) indicates the sound; 扌 conveys the meaning.
  • ⿱ Above to below
    • 與 [ yǔ ] and; with; to; for; to give, to grant
    • 扌 [ shǒu ] hand
①向上擡，向上託：舉頭。舉手。舉重。舉棋不定。
②動作行爲：舉止。輕而易舉。
③發起，興辦：舉義。舉辦。創舉。
④提出：舉要。舉例。
⑤推選，推薦：推舉。薦舉。
⑥全：舉國。舉世。舉家。
⑦古代指科舉取士：科舉。舉人。一舉成名。
⑧攻克：“一戰而舉鄢、郢”。
舉行 [ jǔ xíng ]: to hold (a meeting, ceremony etc)
舉辦 [ jǔ bàn ]: to conduct; to hold
舉措 [ jǔ cuò ]: to move; to act; action; decision; conduct; manner
舉報 [ jǔ bào ]: to report (malefactors to the police); to denounce

Chinese: Back in the day, if a family was having a hard time, their friends would offer them cornstalks for a lift up. Nowadays, they might transfer them some money.

從「 手 」，「 與 」聲，本義為雙手托物使之向上。《說文》：「對舉也。从手，與聲。」《孟子‧告子下》：「今曰舉百鈞，則為有力人矣。」 「 舉 」可表示飛起、升起。《論語‧鄉黨》：「色斯舉矣，翔而後集。」 「 舉 」也表示發問、動問。《禮記‧曲禮上》：「主人不問，客不先舉。」孔穎達疏：「舉亦問也。客從外來，宜問路中寒熱無恙，若主人未問，則客不可先問也。」 「 舉 」還表示言行、舉動。《國語‧魯語上》：「君舉必書，書而不法，後嗣何觀？」韋昭注：「動則左史書之，言則右史書之。」 「 舉 」也表示興起、發動。《史記‧春申君列傳》：「王又舉甲而攻魏。」 「 舉 」亦表示攻克、占領。《穀梁傳‧僖公二年》：「獻公亡虢，五年而後舉虞。」 「 舉 」亦可表示提出、列舉。《論語‧述而》：「舉一隅不以三隅反，則不復也。」
From the sound of " hand" and " and", the original meaning is to hold things up with both hands. "Shuowen": "Right and lift. From the hand, with the sound." "Mencius·Gaozixia": "Today, if you lift a Baijun, you are a powerful person." " Lift" can mean flying, rising. "The Analects of Confucius-Xiangdang": "Se Si lifted up, Xiang and then set." " Ju" also means to ask questions and to ask questions. "Book of Rites-Qu Lishang": "The host does not ask, the guest does not first raise it." Kong Yingdashu: "It also asks. The guest comes from outside, it is recommended to ask whether the road is cold or hot. If the host does not ask, the guest should not ask first. " " Ji" also means words, deeds and actions. "Mandarin-Lu Yushang": "The ruler's judgement must be written, and the book is not lawful. What is the view of the heirs?" Wei Zhao's note: "Motion is left to history, and words are right. " Ji" also means rise and start. "Historical Records: The Biography of Chunshen Jun": "The king raised his armour to attack Wei." " Li" also means to conquer and occupy. "Guliang Chuan-Two Years of Gong Xi": "The sacrifice of the public and the death of the Guo, five years later, will raise concerns." " Cite" can also mean raising or enumerating. "The Analects of Confucius-Shuer": "If you don't take the three corners, you will no longer have it."
